title: Pakistan floods: 'It’s like fighting a war with no end'
description: Pakistan's worst floods in years have left millions homeless and lacking clean drinking water.

title: Leicester 4-0 Nottingham Forest: Steve Cooper faces an uncertain future after another Forest loss
description: Nottingham Forest manager Steve Cooper put a brave face on the 4-0 loss to Leicester, but his job is under threat with the team bottom of the table.

title: Food charity Fareshare's donations from supermarkets drop
description: Demand for Fareshare’s help continues to grow, but there’s been a big fall from their biggest donors.

title: ‘I think there is a space for me’ - can England ignore Maddison?
description: After once again starring for Leicester in their thrashing of Nottingham Forest, can James Maddison force his way into England's World Cup squad?

title: The DIY gadgets that could keep your energy bill down
description: With a little know-how people are tuning their home heating to reduce their gas consumption.

title: Ros Atkins on... why protests are happening in Iran
description: Demonstrations are happening across the country following the death of a woman detained by morality police.

title: Ukraine tank breakthrough in south towards Kherson
description: Russian officials say Ukrainian armour has made advances in the south and east.

title: Jonny Bairstow: England batter out until 2023 after surgery
description: England batter Jonny Bairstow successfully undergoes surgery on a broken leg and dislocated ankle, and confirms he will not play again this year.

title: Leicester 4-0 Nottingham Forest: James Maddison scores twice as Foxes win first game of season
description: Leicester thrash Nottingham Forest to secure their first Premier League win of the season and move off the bottom of the table.

title: Danish Royal Family: Queen 'sorry' after stripping grandchildren's titles
description: But she did not reverse the decision to remove titles from four of her grandchildren.

title: Chancellor Kwasi Kwarteng to set out debt plan earlier than planned
description: The chancellor will publish plans "shortly" after pressure to calm markets over his mini-budget.

title: Rugby World Cup: England's Shaunagh Brown to miss opener after positive Covid-19 test
description: Forward Shaunagh Brown will miss England's opening game of the Rugby World Cup against Fiji on Saturday after testing positive for Covid-19.

title: UK summons Iran diplomat over protest crackdown
description: Iran's top diplomat in the UK is called to the Foreign Office over Tehran's crackdown on protests.

title: Liverpool woman attacked by dogs and killed in Kirkdale house
description: A woman, aged in her 60s, has died after she was attacked by dogs in a Liverpool house, police say.

title: Chancellor attempts to put tax U-turn behind him
description: The chancellor says he wants to focus on delivering growth, after admitting it's been a "tough day".

title: Millions will receive £324 cost-of-living payment in November
description: Those on means-tested benefits will get the money between 8 and 23 November, the government says.

title: Gold coins hidden in 7th Century found in wall
description: The 44 coins found in Israel date to the Muslim conquest of the area in 635, archaeologists say.

title: Will Smith film Emancipation to release this year
description: The slave drama will be released in December, making it eligible for next year's Oscars.

title: 'Systemic' abuse in top-level US women's football
description: Abuse and misconduct "had become systemic" in the United States' top-flight National Women's Soccer League (NWSL), an independent investigation finds.

title: Liverpool v Rangers: 'Champions League will bring best version of Liverpool'
description: Rangers are preparing to face the best version of Liverpool in the Champions League, despite their struggles in the Premier League.

title: Crowdfunding buys 'Tomas the tank' for Ukraine
description: More than 10,000 people donated to the fund, which will supply a modernised T-72 tank.

title: Iga Swiatek: World number one criticises schedule and will not play Billie Jean King Cup Finals
description: World number one Iga Swiatek criticises the scheduling of upcoming tennis events and says she will not be able to play at November's Billie Jean King Cup Finals.

title: Alessia Russo: Manchester United forward withdraws from England squad with 'small injury'
description: Manchester United forward Alessia Russo will miss England's matches against the USA and the Czech Republic through injury.

title: UK at significant risk of gas shortages this winter, warns energy regulator
description: Electricity supplies to people's houses could be disrupted if the country runs short of gas.

title: London Marathon 2022: Man dies after collapsing during event
description: The 36-year-old man became unwell between miles 23 and 24 of the annual 26.2-mile event.

title: Indonesia: Fans 'died in the arms' of players in stadium crush
description: Indonesia says dozens of children, the youngest believed to be just three, are among the dead.

title: Ringo Starr cancels North American tour after catching Covid
description: The Beatles drummer is "recovering at home" and hopes to resume shows soon, his spokesperson says.

title: Nick Eardley: How tax cut policy U-turn was made
description: The PM and chancellor held a series of crisis talks as it became clear the 45p tax cut policy was going to fail.

title: What do government's tax changes mean for me?
description: The government has U-turned over its plan to abolish the 45% rate of income tax, but other tax changes are going ahead.

title: Call an election if you want to change course, Nadine Dorries tells Liz Truss
description: The former culture secretary accuses the new PM of dumping Boris Johnson era policies.

title: Olivia Pratt-Korbel: Man in court accused of schoolgirl's murder
description: Olivia's parents were in court to see Thomas Cashman, 34, charged with murdering the nine-year-old.

title: Kardashian fined over crypto 'pump and dump'
description: Kim Kardashian agrees to pay $1.26m after regulators charge her in EthereumMax case.

title: Mortgage rates rise sharply as squeeze tightens
description: The average two-year fixed rate is now close to 6% as major lenders raise the cost of deals sharply.

title: Mr Doodle: Why I covered my entire house with doodles
description: Artist Sam Cox, known as Mr Doodle, is living his childhood dream in a house he's adorned with his own art.

title: Women's Champions League draw: Arsenal to face eight-time winners Lyon, while Chelsea meet Paris St-Germain
description: Arsenal meet eight-time winners and holders Lyon in the Women's Champions League group stage, while Chelsea face Paris St-Germain.

title: King Charles to host South African president for first state visit
description: President Cyril Ramaphosa's state visit next month will be the first of King Charles' reign.

title: How the late Hilaree Nelson inspired mountaineers
description: Fellow climbers saddened by her death in the Himalayas recall an inspirational figure to a generation of women.

title: Indonesia football crush: How the disaster unfolded
description: Distraught fans demand justice, claiming police use of tear gas triggered a crush which killed 125 people.

title: Worcester Warriors: Bath to sign Ted Hill, Ollie Lawrence, Fergus Lee-Warner and Valery Morozov on loan
description: Bath are to take four players from troubled Worcester - Ted Hill, Ollie Lawrence, Fergus Lee-Warner and Valery Morozov - on loan.

title: Cancer-affected women offered skin-tone soft prosthetics
description: Women of colour being treated at a London hospital can now choose a "softie" to match their skin tone.

title: Nobel Prize goes to Svante Paabo for Neanderthal work
description: Sweden's Svante Paabo wins the prize for discoveries on humanity's extinct relatives.

title: Water rebates for some customers after £150m fines for missing targets
description: Thames Water and Southern Water are hardest hit and will have to return almost £80m to customers.

title: Popular Minecraft YouTuber Dream reveals face
description: The YouTuber's 30 million subscribers finally find out what he looks like without a mask.

title: Chris Mason: Government's U-turn won't be forgotten
description: Tory MPs said the decision to offer the best paid a tax cut was unsellable, the BBC's political editor explains.

title: Brazil election: The presidential race is far from over
description: Lula and Bolsonaro go head-to-head after a closer than expected first-round result.

title: Make cannabis Class A drug, say Conservative police commissioners
description: A group of police and crime commissioners urge tougher penalties for supply and possession.

title: Chris Wilder: Middlesbrough sack manager with club in Championship bottom three
description: Middlesbrough sack boss Chris Wilder after just two wins in their opening 11 games and the club sitting 22nd in the Championship.

title: Chris Eubank Jr v Conor Benn: Eubank's lack of 'respect' for rival's punching power 'scares' Roy Jones Jr
description: Roy Jones Jr speaks to BBC Sport about Chris Eubank Jr v Conor Benn and why he agreed to step aside from coaching Eubank for the fight.

title: Record avian flu outbreak sees 48m birds culled in UK and EU
description: The largest outbreak of avian influenza on record saw 48m birds culled in the UK and EU in the past year.

title: Northern Lights captured at Kielder Observatory
description: Astronomer Dan Monk said it was Northumberland's best display of the aurora borealis "in ages".

title: Fans of Sydney United 58 condemned for Nazi salutes during Australia Cup final
description: Supporters who displayed Nazi symbols and salutes at the Australia Cup final "should be banned for life", a senior government official says.

title: Keyworth street named Britain's best for hedgehogs
description: Residents drilled holes in their fences to create wildlife corridors for the animals.

title: Chancellor expected to back down on 45p tax rate
description: Kwasi Kwarteng is expected to make a statement on scrapping the 45p rate of income tax in the next hour, 10 days after it was announced.

title: The Beatles: Rare images of early Cavern Club gigs found
description: The photos, featuring original drummer Pete Best, were taken a year before debut single Love Me Do.

title: Nuclear test veterans 'need Hillsborough-level apology'
description: Veterans seek justice 70 years after Britain exploded its first nuclear bomb in Operation Hurricane.

title: Sheffield: Incurable cancer patient chosen to model for charity campaign
description: Emma, 41, is fronting a new sportswear brand collection to raise money for a breast cancer charity.

title: Rikki Neave police 'ignored scientific evidence'
description: Original 1994 police inquiry ignored evidence and instead made murder case against boy’s mother, BBC finds.

title: Cost of living: Young cancer patients 'in a desperate situation'
description: Young people with cancer say they are struggling with rent and bills because of soaring living costs.

title: Brazil election: Lula and Bolsonaro to face run-off
description: Neither presidential candidate got more than 50% of the overall vote, meaning they will face off on 30 October.

title: Newspaper headlines: Tories threaten rebellion as 45p vote 'delayed'
description: Growing concerns within the Conservative Party over the PM's tax plans dominate Monday's papers.
